page.title: 18A LITTLEPORT SMALLHOLDING
page.content: It is situated on the outskirts of Littleport on flat low land on Camel Road. The 64 acre farm has been{arable as long as Mr. Jeffreys has owned it. (15 years). He employs five casual labourers to help during the busy times. He works as much as thirteen hours per day. The farm owns four tractors at about Â£20,000 each, a combine harvester (Â£50,000), and many other{machines, including a beet and potato harvester, beet loaders and crawlers. {The land}is mainly heavy silt and light clay. It has been drained with pipes, which run into ditches. Wheat is used for making such items as biscuits, potatoes are stored in a shed and chitted to be planted again and sugar beet is sent to the British Sugar Corporation factory at Wissey to the north, where it is refined.
